page.title: 03HOUSING IN THE CLAYBROOKES
page.content: Along the main street in Claybrooke Magna there were two timber yards and many empty, almost derelict, houses, but during the past six years many changes have taken place. The older houses in the village have been tastefully renovated and a small private housing estate has been developed on the site of one of the old timber yards. Claybrooke Parva too has had some older houses renovated to provide a pleasant corner opposite the church. These changes have made vast improvements in both villages. In Claybrooke Magna there are council houses in Woodland Ave. and a few in Bell St. All other houses in both villages are privately owned.
